query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Poi fummo dentro al soglio de la porta 2 che ’l mal amor de l’anime disusa, 3 perché fa parer dritta la via torta,
query.error: **English:** 1 Then we were inside the threshold of the gate 2 that evil love of the souls in pain, 3 because it makes the crooked way seem straight,
query.result: 1 Þa wæron we innan ðæs geates ðrescold, 2 ðe ðæs yfeles lufe ðara sawla forðyde, 3 forðæm hit ðone wohweg wyrðe rihtlic,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 sonando la senti’ esser richiusa; 5 e s’io avesse li occhi vòlti ad essa, 6 qual fora stata al fallo degna scusa?
query.error: **English:** 4 I heard it being shut, resounding; 5 and if I had turned my eyes to it, 6 what excuse would have been worthy for the fault?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Noi salavam per una pietra fessa, 8 che si moveva e d’una e d’altra parte, 9 sì come l’onda che fugge e s’appressa.
query.error: **English:** 7 We climbed up a cracked stone, 8 which moved this way and that, 9 like a wave that flees and approaches.
query.result: 7 Wit stigon ða up andlang ðære tofelendan stane, 8 ðe ðær afyrsed wæs on ægðre healfe, 9 swa swa ðæt wæg, ðe ðær fliho and genealæco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 «Qui si conviene usare un poco d’arte», 11 cominciò ’l duca mio, «in accostarsi 12 or quinci, or quindi al lato che si parte».
query.error: **English:** 10 "Here it is necessary to use a little skill," 11 my leader began, "in approaching 12 now on this side, now on that, the side that leads away."
query.result: 10 "Her biðearfodðætwegesumecræft," 11 onganminlærend,"onæghwylcehealfe, 12 nutohwearð,nutohðis,ðærðewegtolideð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 E questo fece i nostri passi scarsi, 14 tanto che pria lo scemo de la luna 15 rigiunse al letto suo per ricorcarsi,
query.error: **English:** 13 And this made our steps slow, 14 so much that the moon, which was waning, 15 returned to its bed to rest again,
query.result: 13 And ðis macode ure stepe searwe, 14 swa ðætte ða ðæs monan sceadu, ðe wæs wan, 15 eft ongean ðæs wederes willan

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 che noi fossimo fuor di quella cruna; 17 ma quando fummo liberi e aperti 18 sù dove il monte in dietro si rauna,
query.error: **English:** 16 before we were out of that narrow pass; 17 but when we were free and in the open, 18 up where the mountain draws back,
query.result: 16 ær ðon ðe we of ðam wudu come, 17 ac ða we ðæs wudu ut comen, 18 ðær ðæs beorgæs hlið to ðam bece wende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 ïo stancato e amendue incerti 20 di nostra via, restammo in su un piano 21 solingo più che strade per diserti.
query.error: **English:** 19 I, weary, and both of us uncertain 20 of our way, stopped on a plain 21 more solitary than roads through deserts.
query.result: 19 ða wæs ic ðæs wudu wærig and wunde, 20 and eac ðæs weges ungewiss, 21 and ða we stodon on ðam openan felde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Da la sua sponda, ove confina il vano, 23 al piè de l’alta ripa che pur sale, 24 misurrebbe in tre volte un corpo umano;
query.error: **English:** 22 From its edge, where the void ends, 23 to the foot of the high bank that rises steeply, 24 a human body would measure it in three steps;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 e quanto l’occhio mio potea trar d’ale, 26 or dal sinistro e or dal destro fianco, 27 questa cornice mi parea cotale.
query.error: **English:** 25 and as far as my eye could stretch its wings, 26 now to the left and now to the right flank, 27 this ledge seemed to me to be of such a kind.
query.result: 25 and swa feor swa min eagena gesihð ofer ða earme bradan meahte, 26 nu to ðæm winstran, nu to ðæm swiðran earme, 27 ðuhte me ðeos foresteald swylc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Là sù non eran mossi i piè nostri anco, 29 quand’ io conobbi quella ripa intorno 30 che dritto di salita aveva manco,
query.error: **English:** 28 There where our feet had not yet moved, 29 when I recognized that bank all around, 30 which had a shortcut up on the left,
query.result: 28 Þær ðær ure fet næfre ær ne eodon, 29 ða ic oncneow ða riman ymbutan, 30 ðe steap up ofer hæfde on ðære læwen,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 esser di marmo candido e addorno 32 d’intagli sì, che non pur Policleto, 33 ma la natura lì avrebbe scorno.
query.error: **English:** 31 to be of white marble and adorned 32 with carvings such that not only Polyclitus, 33 but Nature herself would have been put to shame there.
query.result: 31 beon of marman stanum hwitum and fægrum 32 mid gewritum swa, ðæt næfre Polycletus, 33 ac se geweorc ðær geworhte ða gesceafta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 L’angel che venne in terra col decreto 35 de la molt’ anni lagrimata pace, 36 ch’aperse il ciel del suo lungo divieto,
query.error: **English:** 34 The angel who came to earth with the decree 35 of the peace wept for many years, 36 who opened heaven from its long prohibition,
query.result: 34 Se engel þe com on eorðan mid ðam gewrite 35 ðære swiðe lange beweopedan sibbe, 36 se ðe ðone heofon onleac of his langsuman forbode,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 dinanzi a noi pareva sì verace 38 quivi intagliato in un atto soave, 39 che non sembiava imagine che tace.
query.error: **English:** 37 appeared so true before us 38 there, carved in a gentle pose, 39 that it did not seem like an image that is silent.
query.result: 37 he æteowde beforan us swa soðfæst 38 þær awriten on anre gesæligan ansyne, 39 ðæt hit ne wæs nolic ðæt þær swugode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 e avea in atto impressa esta favella 44 ‘Ecce ancilla Deï’, propriamente 45 come figura in cera si suggella.
query.error: **English:** 43 and she had imprinted in her attitude this speech 44 ‘Behold the handmaid of the Lord’, exactly 45 as a figure is stamped in wax.
query.result: 43 and heo hæfde on ðære stefnan ðis word awriten 44 ‘Ecce ancilla Dei’, swilce 45 swa swa anlicnes on wæxe bið gesewen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 «Non tener pur ad un loco la mente», 47 disse ’l dolce maestro, che m’avea 48 da quella parte onde ’l cuore ha la gente.
query.error: **English:** 46 “Do not keep your mind fixed on one place alone,” 47 said the gentle master, who was on that side 48 where people have their heart.
query.result: 46 “Ne læt ðinne mōd on āne stōwe,” 47 cwæð se lēofa lārēow, se ðe me hæfde 48 on ðære healfe ðær ðāra manna heorte is.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Per ch’i’ mi mossi col viso, e vedea 50 di retro da Maria, da quella costa 51 onde m’era colui che mi movea,
query.error: **English:** 49 Therefore I moved with my gaze, and saw 50 behind Mary, on that side 51 from which was he who moved me,
query.result: 49 Forðæm ic me afyrde mid ðæm gesihðe, and geseah 50 æfter Marian, of ðæm sidan 51 ðanon wæs se ðe me styrede,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 un’altra storia ne la roccia imposta; 53 per ch’io varcai Virgilio, e fe’mi presso, 54 acciò che fosse a li occhi miei disposta.
query.error: **English:** 52 another story depicted on the rock; 53 therefore I passed Virgil and drew near, 54 so that it might be displayed to my eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Era intagliato lì nel marmo stesso 56 lo carro e ’ buoi, traendo l’arca santa, 57 per che si teme officio non commesso.
query.error: **English:** 55 There was carved there in the very marble 56 the cart and the oxen, drawing the holy ark, 57 for which one fears an office not entrusted.
query.result: 55 Þær wæs awriten on ðam marmanstan 56 ðæt wægn and ða ylfe ða ða earce læddon, 57 ðurh ðæt ðe man ondræt ðæt unalyfede weorc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Dinanzi parea gente; e tutta quanta, 59 partita in sette cori, a’ due mie’ sensi 60 faceva dir l’un ‘No’, l’altro ‘Sì, canta’.
query.error: **English:** 58 Before me appeared people; and all of them, 59 divided into seven choirs, to my two senses 60 made one say ‘No’, the other ‘Yes, sing’.
query.result: 58 Beforan me wæs folc; and eall hit wæs, 59 todæled on seofon heapas, to ðam twam minum andgite 60 dyde ðone ænne secgan ‘Ne’, ðone oðerne ‘Sing, sing’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Similemente al fummo de li ’ncensi 62 che v’era imaginato, li occhi e ’l naso 63 e al sì e al no discordi fensi.
query.error: **English:** 61 Similarly to the smoke of the incense 62 that was imagined there, the eyes and the nose 63 disagreed with each other about yes and no.
query.result: 61 Eall swilce ðæs recles fyres smic, 62 ðe ðær on innan wæs geðoht, ða eagan and ða nosu 63 on ðam andsware unðances wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Lì precedeva al benedetto vaso, 65 trescando alzato, l’umile salmista, 66 e più e men che re era in quel caso.
query.error: **English:** 64 There, preceding the blessed vessel, 65 dancing and leaping, was the humble psalmist, 66 and in that situation he was more and less than a king.
query.result: 64 Þær beforan ðam gehalgodan fate, 65 plegende and wynsum, se ædela scop, 66 and ma and læs ðonne cyning wæs on ðam gefean.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Di contra, effigïata ad una vista 68 d’un gran palazzo, Micòl ammirava 69 sì come donna dispettosa e trista.
query.error: **English:** 67 On the other side, depicted in a vision 68 of a grand palace, Michal was gazing, 69 as a disdainful and sad woman.
query.result: 67 On ðære healfe, awriten on ðære gesyhðe 68 miceles healles, Miðel wæs wuniende, 69 swa swa wif unrot and unbliðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 I’ mossi i piè del loco dov’ io stava, 71 per avvisar da presso un’altra istoria, 72 che di dietro a Micòl mi biancheggiava.
query.error: **English:** 70 I moved my feet from the place where I was standing, 71 to examine more closely another story, 72 which was gleaming white behind Michal.
query.result: 70 Ic āhōf mīne fēt of ðǣre stōwe ðǣr ic stōd, 71 for ðǣm ðe ic wolde nēar sīen ōðre stōwe, 72 ðe scān beæftan Mīchōle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Quiv’ era storïata l’alta gloria 74 del roman principato, il cui valore 75 mosse Gregorio a la sua gran vittoria;
query.error: **English:** 73 Here was depicted the great glory 74 of the Roman Empire, whose valor 75 moved Gregory to his great victory;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 i’ dico di Traiano imperadore; 77 e una vedovella li era al freno, 78 di lagrime atteggiata e di dolore.
query.error: **English:** 76 I speak of the Emperor Trajan; 77 and a widow was at his bridle, 78 her face wet with tears and grief.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Intorno a lui parea calcato e pieno 80 di cavalieri, e l’aguglie ne l’oro 81 sovr’ essi in vista al vento si movieno.
query.error: **English:** 79 Around him seemed pressed and full 80 of knights, and the eagles in the gold 81 above them in view moved in the wind.
query.result: 79 Ymb hine ða wæron wigan gerihte 80 and ofer ðam golde grundwongas 81 ofer ðam here herefugolas

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 La miserella intra tutti costoro 83 pareva dir: «Segnor, fammi vendetta 84 di mio figliuol ch’è morto, ond’ io m’accoro»;
query.error: **English:** 82 The wretched woman among all these 83 seemed to say: "Lord, avenge me 84 for my son who is dead, which grieves me";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 ed elli a lei rispondere: «Or aspetta 86 tanto ch’i’ torni»; e quella: «Segnor mio», 87 come persona in cui dolor s’affretta,
query.error: **English:** 85 and he replied to her: "Now wait 86 until I return"; and she: "My lord," 87 like a person in whom grief is urgent,
query.result: 85 and he ða hire andswarode: "Nu ðu geanbid 86 oððæt ic eft cume"; and heo ða cwæð: "Min hlaford", 87 swa swa ðæt wif ðe ðone sare hæfde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 «se tu non torni?»; ed ei: «Chi fia dov’ io, 89 la ti farà»; ed ella: «L’altrui bene 90 a te che fia, se ’l tuo metti in oblio?»;
query.error: **English:** 88 "if you do not return?" And he: "Whoever is where I am, 89 will do it for you"; and she: "What good is the good of others to you, 90 if you forget your own?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 ond’ elli: «Or ti conforta; ch’ei convene 92 ch’i’ solva il mio dovere anzi ch’i’ mova: 93 giustizia vuole e pietà mi ritene».
query.error: **English:** 91 To which he: "Now take comfort; for it is fitting 92 that I fulfill my duty before I move: 93 justice demands it and pity holds me back".
query.result: 91 ða cwæð he: "Nu ðu ðe getrym; forðæm hit is rihtlic 92 ðæt ic ðæt ðing ærst agylde ðe ic ðe sceal, ærðam ðe ic heonon gewende: 93 rihtwisnes hit wile and mildheortnes me hit forbiet".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Colui che mai non vide cosa nova 95 produsse esto visibile parlare, 96 novello a noi perché qui non si trova.
query.error: **English:** 94 He who never saw anything new 95 produced this visible speech, 96 new to us because it is not found here.
query.result: 94 Se ðe næfre nānwuht niwes ne geseah 95 geworhte ðis gesewenlic spell, 96 niwe us forðæm ðe hit her ne bið.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Mentr’ io mi dilettava di guardare 98 l’imagini di tante umilitadi, 99 e per lo fabbro loro a veder care,
query.error: **English:** 97 While I was delighting myself in gazing 98 at the images of so much humility, 99 and in seeing them precious because of their Maker,
query.result: 97 Þa ic me ongan ða gesion gesihðan 98 ðara eaðmodnesse micla, 99 and for ðam wyrhtan wurðfulle wlite,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 «Ecco di qua, ma fanno i passi radi», 101 mormorava il poeta, «molte genti: 102 questi ne ’nvïeranno a li alti gradi».
query.error: **English:** 100 “Behold, over there, but they make their steps rare,” 101 the poet was murmuring, “many people: 102 these will direct us to the high grades.”
query.result: 100 “Efne her syndon, ac ða fæðe stapas,” 101 mumrode se scop, “manige menigo: 102 ðas us lædað to ðam hean hleoðum.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Li occhi miei, ch’a mirare eran contenti 104 per veder novitadi ond’ e’ son vaghi, 105 volgendosi ver’ lui non furon lenti.
query.error: **English:** 103 My eyes, which were content to gaze 104 to see new things for which they are eager, 105 turning towards him were not slow.
query.result: 103 Mine eagan, ða ðe wæron georne to geseonne 104 niwe ðing ðara ðe hi gewilniað, 105 wendon him toweard and næron ða slaw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Non vo’ però, lettor, che tu ti smaghi 107 di buon proponimento per udire 108 come Dio vuol che ’l debito si paghi.
query.error: **English:** 106 I do not want you, reader, to be dismayed 107 by good intentions when you hear 108 how God wants the debt to be paid.
query.result: 106 Ne wille ic ðeah, ðu ðe læs geômrige, 107 ðurh ðone gōdan willan ðe ðu hæfst, ðonne ðu gehyrst, 108 hu God wile ðæt man ðā gyltas gebete.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Non attender la forma del martìre: 110 pensa la succession; pensa ch’al peggio 111 oltre la gran sentenza non può ire.
query.error: **English:** 109 Do not dwell on the form of martyrdom: 110 think of the succession; think that for the worst 111 beyond the great judgment it cannot go.
query.result: 109 Ne ðu ðære martyre gemet ðæs hiwes gime: 110 ðenceað ðone fyliged; ðenceað ðæt ðurh ða miclan dôm 111 hit wyrs ne mæg geweorðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Io cominciai: «Maestro, quel ch’io veggio 113 muovere a noi, non mi sembian persone, 114 e non so che, sì nel veder vaneggio».
query.error: **English:** 112 I began: "Master, those whom I see 113 moving towards us do not seem to be people, 114 and I do not know what they are, so I am deluded in my sight."
query.result: 112 Ic ongan ða: "Lareow, ða ðe ic geseo 113 hiderwerd hweorfan, ne synt hi mennisce, 114 and nat ic hwæt, swa ic on ðam gesihðe wene."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ed elli a me: «La grave condizione 116 di lor tormento a terra li rannicchia, 117 sì che ’ miei occhi pria n’ebber tencione.
query.error: **English:** 115 And he said to me: "The grievous condition 116 of their torment makes them crouch down to the ground, 117 so that my eyes had a dispute with them at first.
query.result: 115 And he sæde to me: "Ðara hefig tintrega 116 heora tintregna to eorðan licgað, 117 swa ðæt mine eagan ær heora ne wendon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ma guarda fiso là, e disviticchia 119 col viso quel che vien sotto a quei sassi: 120 già scorger puoi come ciascun si picchia».
query.error: **English:** 118 But look closely there, and with your gaze 119 unravel what comes beneath those rocks: 120 you can already make out how each one beats himself.
query.result: 118 Ac lociað ðær fæste and ða forðgesceaft 119 mid ðinum gesihðe ðæt ðe ðær under ðam stane stent: 120 ðu miht ðær gesion hu heora gehwylc hine sylfne sleað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 O superbi cristian, miseri lassi, 122 che, de la vista de la mente infermi, 123 fidanza avete ne’ retrosi passi,
query.error: **English:** 121 O proud Christians, wretched and weary, 122 who, sick in the sight of your mind, 123 have trust in backward steps,
query.result: 121 Ea, ofermodige Cristne, earme wrecce, 122 ðe, ðurh ðære gesihðe ðæs modes untrume, 123 hyht habbað on ða abæcwendan stapas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 non v’accorgete voi che noi siam vermi 125 nati a formar l’angelica farfalla, 126 che vola a la giustizia sanza schermi?
query.error: **English:** 124 do you not realize that we are worms, 125 born to form the angelic butterfly, 126 that flies to justice without barriers?
query.result: 124 ne geseoð ge ðæt we synt wyrmas, 125 acennede to ðære engliscan buttorfleogan, 126 ðe to ðære rihtwisnesse fleoð butan gescyldum?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Di che l’animo vostro in alto galla, 128 poi siete quasi antomata in difetto, 129 sì come vermo in cui formazion falla?
query.error: **English:** 127 Why does your spirit soar so high, 128 when you are almost like defective automatons, 129 like a worm in which formation fails?
query.result: 127 For ðon ðin mod on hehðu swimð, 128 ðonne eart ðu swilce unspedig automatum, 129 swilce wyrm ðær ðære gesceapenesse gebrec bið?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Come per sostentar solaio o tetto, 131 per mensola talvolta una figura 132 si vede giugner le ginocchia al petto,
query.error: **English:** 130 As to support a ceiling or roof, 131 sometimes a figure is seen as a bracket 132 joining its knees to its chest,
query.result: 130 Swa to gehealdanne soler oððe ðæc, 131 ðurh mensole hwilum anlicnes 132 bið gesewen gebiged to ðam breoste ða cneow,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 la qual fa del non ver vera rancura 134 nascere ’n chi la vede; così fatti 135 vid’ io color, quando puosi ben cura.
query.error: **English:** 133 which makes a false but real anguish 134 arise in the one who sees it; thus 135 I saw those people, when I paid close attention.
query.result: 133 ðe ðone unsoðan soðne hryre 134 awecð on ðam ðe hine gesihð; ðus 135 ic ða geseah ða menn, ða ic wel georne beheold.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Vero è che più e meno eran contratti 137 secondo ch’avien più e meno a dosso; 138 e qual più pazïenza avea ne li atti,
query.error: **English:** 136 It is true that more and less they were contracted 137 according as they had more or less on their backs; 138 and whoever had more patience in his actions,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 piangendo parea dicer: ‘Più non posso’.
query.error: **English:** 139 weeping seemed to say: ‘I can do no more’.
query.result: 139 wepende ðuhte secgan: ‘Ic ne mæg na mare’.
